title: Header downloader stuck on Ropsten 11283068
body:
#### System information

Erigon version: erigon version 2021.11.2-alpha from commit 3d3a1d30cc8366d95d7fd6d1c2e1f7a6d5d5d099

OS & Version: Ubuntu 20.04.2 LTS

Commit hash : 3d3a1d30cc8366d95d7fd6d1c2e1f7a6d5d5d099

#### Expected behaviour

When running for a long time it should report progress of the sync.

#### Actual behaviour

The progress is stuck somewhere on block 11283068.
( Ropsten has 11391945 blocks total )

It keeps reporting the memory growth in the stuck state:
```
[INFO] [11-08|18:28:48.728] [1/15 Headers] Wrote block headers       number=11283068 blk/second=0.000 alloc="115.75 MiB" sys="207.16 MiB"
[INFO] [11-08|18:38:18.728] [1/15 Headers] Wrote block headers       number=11283068 blk/second=0.000 alloc="416.38 MiB" sys="681.07 MiB"
[INFO] [11-08|18:48:18.728] [1/15 Headers] Wrote block headers       number=11283068 blk/second=0.000 alloc="682.46 MiB" sys="949.70 MiB"
[INFO] [11-08|19:41:48.728] [1/15 Headers] Wrote block headers       number=11283068 blk/second=0.000 alloc="871.45 MiB" sys="1.19 GiB"
[INFO] [11-08|20:21:48.728] [1/15 Headers] Wrote block headers       number=11283068 blk/second=0.000 alloc="1.57 GiB" sys="2.45 GiB"
[INFO] [11-08|20:34:18.728] [1/15 Headers] Wrote block headers       number=11283068 blk/second=0.000 alloc="6.94 GiB" sys="8.13 GiB"
[INFO] [11-08|20:38:48.729] [1/15 Headers] Wrote block headers       number=11283068 blk/second=0.000 alloc="11.96 GiB" sys="14.80 GiB"
[INFO] [11-08|20:43:18.728] [1/15 Headers] Wrote block headers       number=11283068 blk/second=0.000 alloc="8.92 GiB" sys="16.39 GiB"
[INFO] [11-08|20:47:48.728] [1/15 Headers] Wrote block headers       number=11283068 blk/second=0.000 alloc="15.03 GiB" sys="23.72 GiB"
```

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour

```
nohup "$HOME/erigon/build/bin/erigon" \
	--verbosity 4 \
	--port 30303 \
	--p2p.eth65.port 30304 \
	--chain ropsten \
	--datadir /mnt/nvme/data1/ \
	--nat extip:x.x.x.x \
	>> "$HOME/ropsten.log" 2>&1 &
```

Closer to the end it starts reporting:
```
[DBUG] [11-08|20:49:26.210] NewAnchor failed                         error="new anchor too far in the past: 11211987, latest header in db: 11283068"
```
But this might not be relevant.

Note: restart doesn't help.

#### Backtrace

[backtrace.txt](https://github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/files/7503791/backtrace.txt)
